passage_text: A nucleotide is made up of a sugar (deoxyribose in DNA and ribose in RNA), a phosphate and a nitrogenous base. The nitrogenous bases found in DNA are adenine (A), thymine (T …), cytosine (C) and guanine (G). 1 person found this useful.

The nucleotide in DNA consists of a sugar (deoxyribose), one of four bases (cytosine (C), thymine (T), adenine (A), guanine (G)), and a phosphate. Cytosine and thymine are pyrimidine bases, while adenine and guanine are purine bases. The sugar and the base together are called a nucleoside.

Nucleotide Definition: A nucleotide is an organic molecule made up of a nucleotide base, a five-carbon sugar (ribose or deoxyribose) and at least one phosphate group. Nucleotides make up the basic units of DNA and RNA molecules.
